description.plain:
Thomas Luther “Luke” Bryan was born July 17, 1976 in Leesburg, Georgia, to Tommy and LeClaire Watkins Bryan.  His parents also raised him in Leesburg. At age 14, his parents bought him his first guitar, and after learning to play it, he joined various local bands and began to play in local clubs. After graduating Lee County High School, Bryan planned to move to Nashville, Tennessee; however, this move was delayed, due to the death of his brother, Chris, in a car accident, on the same day he planned to leave. Luke attended Georgia Southern University, and is a member of the Eta Zeta chapter of the Sigma Chi Fraternity. After graduation Luke went to work for his dad, despite everyone encouraging him to move to Tennessee. His dad encouraged him to relocate and he arrived in Nashville in 2001, signing a record deal only two months later. The 6'01/2" singer-songwriter married Caroline Boyer on December 8, 2006.  The couple have two sons.  Thomas “Bo” Boyer Bryan was born March 18, 2008 and Tatum “Tate” Christopher Bryan was born August 11, 2010.  Luke’s nephew Tilden “Til” Cheshire also lives with the Bryan’s, after his mother (Luke’s older sister, Kelly) died in 2007 and his father died in 2014.  Among the songs Luke is known for are “Drunk on You” and “Someone Else Calling You Baby”.

Awards/Honors:
Country Music Association Awards:
2015 Entertainer of the Year

songs.full_title: Play It Again by Luke Bryan
songs.title: Play It Again

description.plain:
“Play It Again” is a song from Luke Bryan’s album, Crash My Party. It’s about him getting a girlfriend with the power of music.

The song was written by Dallas Davidson and Ashley Gorley, and released on March 24, 2014. On April 17, 2014, “Play It Again” became Bryan’s eighth non-consecutive chart-topper on the Hot Country Songs, the most by any act in the time since his first #1 “Rain Is a Good Thing” hit the top spot on July 24, 2010.

description.plain:
This is a sultry slow jam that uses wordplay to make the point that this man and wife need to get back to the basics of love.

“Strip It Down” is an iTunes countdown single from Bryan’s 2015 album, Kill The Lights. Released with a preorder of the album.

songs.full_title: Kick the Dust Up by Luke Bryan
songs.title: Kick the Dust Up

description.plain:
Luke’s May 2015 single goes “off-road,” according to USA TODAY – we can only imagine he’s driving a Bronco.

The reason for calling it “off-road?” It’s clearly pop-influenced, with smoothly produced guitar and drums along with loud claps and a small buildup as a post-chorus. Despite the musical changes, though, it’s still Luke Bryan.

songs.full_title: Drink a Beer by Luke Bryan
songs.title: Drink a Beer

description.plain:
“Drink A Beer,” the third single off Luke Bryan’s 2013 album, Crash My Party, is about losing a loved one.

Bryan recorded the song and attached it to the tragic story of having lost two of his siblings. Its sad, yet simplistic lyrics, tug on the hearts strings of anyone who has lost a love one, making it an unforgettably commiserative song.

At the 2013 CMA’s, Bryan performed the song while sitting on a stool, keeping his eyes closed for most of it, in memory of his brother and sister.

https://youtu.be/RM5aW83L_DE

songs.full_title: Country Girl (Shake It for Me) by Luke Bryan
songs.title: Country Girl (Shake It for Me)

description.plain:
“Country Girl (Shake It for Me)” is a song about “a country girl getting up there getting a little wild”, according to co-writer Dallas Davidson in Country Weekly.

Bryan said that he and Davidson came up with the idea after listening to hip-hop songs, when Bryan began playing a “groove”. He then told Davidson that the country genre needed more songs about “country girls shaking it a little bit”.

songs.full_title: Home Alone Tonight by Luke Bryan (Ft. Karen Fairchild)
songs.title: Home Alone Tonight

description.plain:
Luke Bryan brings in Karen Fairchild to record “Home Alone Tonight,” the third single from his fifth studio album, Kill The Lights. Released on August 7, 2015, the song reached #1 on Billboard’s US Country Airplay.

Lyrically, it is about two people meeting in a bar and taking “payback” pictures of themselves together to make their exes jealous.

Although the song sounds like a back-and-forth dialogue between two people, Bryan and Fairchild actually recorded each of their lines from the song apart from each other.

It had been a while before Bryan had recorded a duet, but he said it was just a matter of waiting for the right song to come along.

We had always certainly entertained the right collaboration under the right circumstances, but it’s always about the right song, and we’ve never really found the song that necessarily did what we wanted it to do.

songs.full_title: One Margarita by Luke Bryan
songs.title: One Margarita

description.plain: I don’t second-guess the timing. I chose to just put out a fun song, and I look forward to when I can perform it live. If you’re a fan of mine and you don’t like the song, don’t write me off for the rest of your life. Wait around till I put something out that’s more what you want to hear from me. That’s what I used to do with all my heroes. When George Strait put out a song that I didn’t care for, I didn’t have a platform to tell the world. I just chose not to freak out about that particular song.

songs.full_title: Muckalee Creek Water by Luke Bryan
songs.title: Muckalee Creek Water

description.plain:
Muckalee Creek means ‘home’ for Luke Bryan. Muckalee Creek, (part of the Flint River) and the 32 bridge area have influenced many references throughout Luke’s music catalog.

“Down where I was born was Heaven on Earth, the Flint River washes that red Georgia dirt”
- We Rode in Trucks

“Floatin' down the Flint River, catch us up a little catfish dinner”
- That’s My Kinda Night

“Just follow me down ‘neath the 32 bridge, y'alla be glad you did”
-Kick The Dust Up

Listen as Luke sheds some light on the area and his clothing company ‘32 Bridge’:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LdZWQIDKokU

… Justin Moore croons about the Flint River, too, in “If Heaven Wasn’t So Far Away.”

Every day I drive to work across Flint River Bridge…

songs.lyrics:
It flows underneath the 32 bridge
And cuts through the heart of South Georgia
Big copperheads and mean wild pigs
And gators in the weeds waiting for ya
I leave my phone in the truck
I leave my truck at the road
My four-wheeler gets me where I wanna go
I leave the world behind
I pull my hat down low
Get back to my roots, by a full moon glow

I got an old Jon boat that I stowed down there
On them hot summer nights when I get a-wild hare
I got a moonshine stash in a cypress stump
And a catfish line going - bump bump
An old tractor tire where I sit by the fire
And drink to a sweet swamp song
So if you're looking for me, don't even bother
When I dip my feet in that Muckalee Creek water

Daddy brought me down here when I was a kid
Taught me how to bait a craw fish basket
From the time I was old enough to walk
He had me running down squirrels and rabbits
I feel right at home in this neck of the woods
If this was all I had, I'd be living good
So let the stock market do what it's gonna do
Let the dollar go down and gas over the roof

I got an old Jon boat that I stowed down there
On them hot summer nights when I get a-wild hare
I got a moonshine stash in a cypress stump
And a catfish line going - bump bump
An old tractor tire where I sit by the fire
And drink to a sweet swamp song
So if you're looking for me, don't even bother
When I dip my feet in that Muckalee Creek water

I'm free, and I'm me
Being everything that I wanna be
Nobody jacking with me
No sign of the city lights
Hell with the city lights!

I got an old Jon boat that I stowed down there
On them hot summer nights when I get a-wild hare
I got a moonshine stash in a cypress stump
And a catfish line going - bump bump bump
An old tractor tire where I sit by the fire
And drink to a sweet swamp song
So if you're looking for me, don't even holler
When I get down deep in that Muckalee Creek water
That Muckalee Creek water

songs.full_title: My Ol' Bronco by Luke Bryan
songs.title: My Ol’ Bronco

description.plain:
Bryan opens up his final Spring Break album with a classic country subject – an aging car that’s still kickin' in its old age.

In his interview with Buzzfeed, Bryan mentions how this is the lemon-yellow convertible bronco that was on the cover of Spring Break: Here to Party, the fifth record of his seven-EP series.

The ol' Bronco has been in every single Spring Break show, and I had a lot of memories in [it].

annotatable.title: I Don't Know How To Pronounce Gyro

body.plain: First aired on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon with country superstar Luke Bryan. It talks about the pronunciation of the word “gyro”.

songs.lyrics:
Hey, you want some lunch? I'm buying
Yeah man, I'm starving. What are you getting?
I'll have the falafel plate, please. How about you?
The uh, you know the uh, that thing there
(I can't see, which one?)
Um, the brown stuff that you, uh, you know, it's...
Man, man I'm good
Are you kidding me? What's going on man, you okay?
Not exactly

I was born in Southwest Georgia
Always tried to make my daddy proud
But of all the things I've learned there
Never learned how to say that word out loud
I just want something to eat
Made with a vertical rotisserie of lamb meat

I think I know just what you're going through
The way they spelled that gosh darn word seems like a trap
It's just lamb meat and other stuff rolled up in a pita
I wish they'd just called it a lamb tzatziki wrap
I could eat a thousand ounces
If I just knew how to pronounce it

Is it gee-ro, jyro, here-o, or yai-ro?
Never been filled with so much doubt
Is it gwy-ro, ga-hee-ro, yurro, or worbtse?
We can safely rule that last one out

I can't believe I don't know how to say
I eat so many that you'd really think I would
Well my friend it looks like we're in a pickle
Actually a pickle on a wrap sounds pretty good
Well always thought I was a pretty cultured dude
Been to the Taj Mahal, the Great Wall, and the Louvre
I'm fluent in Italian and efficient in Croatian
But when it comes to pronunciation of this particular word...
I'm an abomination

Is it gyro? Is it gyro? I'll ask my friend from Kairo
He's usually pretty good with this stuff
Or maybe I'll just mumble it when I place my order
(Not so fast, I caught your bluff)
Well, uh, how would you pronounce it then?
(Gyro)

It is gyro, it is gyro
Now I know it's gyro
The truth is so delicious to find
No more fearo, you're a hero
Cause now I know it's gyro
I finally got some piece of mind
We finally got some piece of mind

I'll take one gyro please
(You got it, buddy)
Um, can I change that actually
I'd love a shish keabob with a little extra humus

description.plain:
“You and the Beach” is the 7th track on Luke Bryan’s album, Spring Break… Checkin' Out.

Here’s what he had to say in a Buzzfeed interview:

[It’s] a song that has a lot of emotion, it’s kind of sad […] It’s about this guy who [fell] in love (with a girl), but like every spring break, everybody’s gotta go back their own way.

“Checkin' Out” refers to Luke Bryan “checking out” of Panama City Beach. This spring break was his last Panama City Beach concert, and all of the songs on the album relate to his times at PCB and his fun on Spring Break.

songs.lyrics:
It's time to take my drunk ass home
I drank all the whiskey and my money's all gone
Hit on all the girls, sang every song
It's time to take my drunk ass home

Well, I worked all week
So I could come here
Have a good time and an ice cold beer
But one turned to 10 and 10 turned to 20
And 20 plus an empty bottle's too damn many

It's time to take my drunk ass home
I drank all the whiskey and my money's all gone
Hit on all the girls, sang every song
It's time to take my drunk ass home

Well it seems that I, misplaced my shirt
I can’t find my keys for all this parking lot dirt
My fall back plan, has done got sad
'Cause my ex-girlfriend aren’t looking half bad

It's time to take my drunk ass home
I drank all the whiskey and my money's all gone
Hit on all the girls, sang every song
It's time to take my drunk ass home
"Help me up, aww, put me back down, put me back down"

I sucker punched my best friend
And the bouncer head locked me on stage with the band
I, I look like hell, I feel like shit
I think it’s time I call it quits

It's time to take my drunk ass home
I drank all the whiskey and my money's all gone
Hit on all the girls, sang every song
It's time to take my drunk ass home

Yeah, it’s time to take my drunk ass home
I twisted up my ankle, can’t find my cell phone
Yeah, my lips all busted and my buzz is gone
It's time to take my drunk ass home
If y'all agree, then sing along
It's time to take, my drunk ass home

"Oh somebody call me a cab, please"
